author: John Cross
title: Sadio Mane determined to get Liverpool's season back on road after his agonising Africa Cup of Nations absence
text:
Sport Sadio Mane determined to get Liverpool's season back on road after his agonising Africa Cup of Nations absence While the forward was missing the quarter-final shoot-out penalty that put Senegal out and led to angry fans attacking his uncle's car, the Reds were stalling without him Share Liverpool star Mane told our John Cross a top-four finish IS still in for his off-form Reds (Photo: Getty Images Europe) Share Get Liverpool FC   Thank you for subscribing!   
Sadio Mane has become used to fans getting upset when results do not go to plan. 
Liverpool forward Mane was the unfortunate fall-guy in the penalty shoot-out when red-hot favourites Senegal lost to Cameroon in the quarter-finals of the Africa Cup of Nations last month. 
Unhappy Senegal fans attacked Mane’s uncle’s car after the shock exit. So after coming through that painful experience, the current problems at Anfield will not faze him. 
The Reds ’ form went into free-fall during the 24-year-old’s month-long absence on international duty — the dismal defeat at Leicester this week means Jurgen Klopp’s men have managed just ONE Premier League win since the turn of the year. 
The decline has seen Liverpool not just slip out of the title race but drop out of the top four. AFCON 2017 ended in despair and on penalties for Mane and his Senegal team-mates (Photo: AFP) Read More Ten times Jamie Carragher brilliantly - and brutally - trolled famous footballers 
Little wonder Mane is so keen to help his team, who now sit fifth, re-ignite their season when fourth-placed Arsenal visit for Saturday's evening kickoff. 
“If you miss a penalty and you lose then it’s not easy to accept," he said of that fateful spot-kick in Gabon. "But it’s part of football. You have to work harder for the next game and be sure you are mentally strong. 
“It was my uncle’s car. When I called my uncle, it was a big surprise. 
"I know the people of Senegal and they are very supportive. Maybe two or three people did something, but generally I get big support from the people of Senegal. 
“At Liverpool, we have the best fans in the league, the best fans in the world. 
"This team can do so much more with their support behind us, they help us so much.” 
There have been so many stories down the years of players reporting late after tournaments but that was never going to happen in Mane’s case. Mane spoke of his love for Liverpool's fans and desire to deliver for them (Photo: Daily Mirror) Read More How Liverpool's 13 loanees are doing this season - and what their future prospect are 
Softly-spoken but with perfect English after three seasons in the Premier League with first Southampton and now the Reds, he was anxious to get back to Liverpool as quickly as possible — and the club showed how much they wanted him to return by hiring a private jet. 
He flew in and immediately took his place on the bench for the Anfield draw with Chelsea, then started in the defeat at Hull five days later. But his impact was really felt the following week when he scored twice in a Man of the Match display against top-four chase rivals Tottenham. 
That is what Liverpool will be hoping for against Arsenal — a big reaction after a defeat and a big performance from a player who has better statistics (11 goals and four assists in 22 games) than Chelsea’s Eden Hazard. Liverpool's best display in recent months saw Mane score twice as they beat Spurs (Photo: AFP/Getty) Read More Manchester police invite Robbie Fowler on tour of station after Twitter spat 
Mane said: “After the [Cameroon] game, everybody else was going back to Senegal whereas I was the only one going straight back to Europe. 
"They were asking, 'How can it be possible that he’s going straight back to his club?’ But if you are wanted by your club, if they need you then you have to be a professional and go straight home. You have to help your team, try to fight for the future and get back as soon as possible. 
"I wanted to play again straight away. I think mentally I was ready, even though I was tired. 
“I’m convinced that we are going to change it positively. We have a great team, great spirit and we have a great mentality. We are going to work hard to really turn it round.” 
Mane was one of the most sought-after players in the Premier League when Liverpool signed him last summer — Manchester United tried to get him from Saints the previous year, and Manchester City had also been keen. While Sane was on international duty Liverpool went out of the EFL Cup... (Photo: AFP/Getty) ...and the FA Cup in the space of four January days... (Photo: Getty) ...and here's James Milner indicating how many league wins they have in 2017 (Photo: Getty) Read More 
But his decision to move to Anfield in a record-breaking £36m deal was largely down to Klopp — and the German manager’s enthusiasm, drive and determination is also why Mane believes the Reds are capable of a top-four finish. 
“Yes, I think we can,” he said. 
“We have a great team spirit in this dressing room. Win, lose or draw, which can always happen, we always come back and we are always looking forward for a positive reaction. Sometimes it’s easy - and sometimes it’s not easy! 
“I am very lucky to have the coach here. As a player, you always have to think about where you are going, what you can do there and I had another options. Jurgen Klopp is a great manager, a great person as well. From when he met me, he made it so easy for me to adapt not just in the team but also at the club as well. Liverpool was the only place for me. 
“Everybody was disappointed after Leicester, because we played great football in the Tottenham game and how we lost [to the champions] was not easy. Mane scored the decisive fourth as Liverpool beat Saturday's foes Arsenal 4-3 in the season opener (Photo: Getty) Read More Gerrard proved he'll become a great manager that night in Istanbul, says Djibril Cisse 
"You can play very well and lose but if you lose and don’t play at your level then it makes you even more disappointed. 
“We are looking for a strong reaction. Everybody expects us to come back strongly and I think we can beat any team in this league. 
“We had an incredible game at Arsenal on the first day of the season. It was 2, 3 and then 4-1 [Liverpool scored three times in 14 second-half minutes, with Mane getting the last one] and then suddenly Arsenal have come back and it finished 4-3. 
"It was a good memory from the past because we won the game and we are looking to win again." poll loading Who will win on Saturday? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
